_comment: Created by rreed on 05/01/2017 15:05:32 using v2.7
title: How has GP care for CKD patients changed?
analysis_commentary: GPs have a good record of taking 15 monthly blood pressure measures for patients diagnosed with stage 3-5 CKD, which has never fallen below 97%. The percentage of patients whose blood pressure is below the recommended threshold (140/85) has been increasing slowly for many years. However, the percentage with hypertension and proteinuria who are treated with an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker (where appropriate) has been declining slightly since 2009/10. The percentage that have a urine albumin: creatinine ratio recorded in their notes in the same period was consistently 82%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Quality and Outcomes Framework
